thread.title: Ryanair enjoys profit and passenger boost
thread.title_full: Ryanair enjoys profit and passenger boost

title: Ryanair enjoys profit and passenger boost
text:
Save 
Ryanair has reported a 25% rise in profits despite average fares falling during its first quarter. 
Profit after tax increased from €197 million to €245 million for the three months to the end of June. Revenue grew by 10% to €1.7 billion. 28 million people flew with the airline up 16% from 24.3 million. 
Ryanair managed to lower its unit costs by 7%, which meant it could pass on lower fares to consumers. In the period average fares fell by 4% to €45 “due to the timing of Easter, weaker April yields and lower checked bag penetration”. 
The improved performance was not enough to persuade the airline to increase its full-year net profit forecast, which remains between €940 million to €970 million. However, Ryanair now says “slightly better H1 yields will push it towards the upper end” of the estimate.
